search_query: Autodesk ADSK competitors 2025 CAD design software
context: Autodesk has 9.26% market share in the CAD software market and competes with 79 competitor tools. However, AutoCAD (Autodesk's flagship product) holds 39.01% market share, making it the dominant player. Over 43,891 companies worldwide use Autodesk as a CAD software tool in 2025, with 17,580 customers (53.72%) from the United States. Autodesk offers multiple products including AutoCAD, Fusion 360 (cloud-based unified platform), and Inventor (on-premise 3D CAD).

competitors.name: SolidWorks
competitors.notes: Second-largest with 13.58% market share in CAD Software. Powerful 3D mechanical design software for automotive, aerospace, consumer products, and machinery. User-friendly interface and strong community, popular for small to medium-sized businesses.

competitors.name: AutoCAD Mechanical
competitors.notes: Autodesk's own product with 5.35% market share. Internal competition within Autodesk product family.

competitors.name: BricsCAD
competitors.notes: Easy to use, easy to learn, and costs significantly less than other CAD software. Preserves command-line workflow familiar to AutoCAD users but extends functionality with parametric constraints and design automation. More efficient in handling large point clouds and complex 3D models.

competitors.name: FreeCAD
competitors.notes: Best free and open-source AutoCAD alternative. Designed for 2D and 3D modeling with parametric modeling support. Highly customizable and extendable through plugins with modular architecture.

competitors.name: SketchUp
competitors.notes: Impressively natural modeling experience for spatial designs. More accessible for professionals who find AutoCAD too complex for conceptual development.

competitors.name: DraftSight
competitors.notes: Most popular commercial alternative to Autodesk AutoCAD.

competitors.name: LibreCAD
competitors.notes: Open source 2D CAD application for Windows, Apple and Linux, based on Qt. Leading cross-platform application and UI development framework.

competitors.name: Fusion 360
competitors.notes: Autodesk's own cloud-based unified design platform integrating CAD, CAM, and CAE. Collaborative environment for simultaneous multi-user work. Powerful parametric modeling, rendering, and simulation features.

competitors.name: Inventor
competitors.notes: Autodesk's on-premise 3D CAD software for professional-grade design, documentation, and product simulation.

competitors.name: ActCAD
competitors.notes: Professional grade 2D Drafting and 3D Modeling CAD software working in DWG and DXF file formats.

competitors.name: Siemens NX
competitors.notes: Enterprise-grade CAD solution for complex assemblies, regulatory requirements, and deep PLM integration.

competitors.name: PTC Creo
competitors.notes: Enterprise CAD software for advanced assemblies and deep PLM integration via Windchill.
